alfredsnippet.snippet:
https://stream.org/doubt-scientific-consensus/

"Tenure, job promotions, government grants, media accolades, social respectability, Wikipedia entries, and vanity can do what gulags do, only more subtly. Alexis de Tocqueville warned of this almost two centuries ago. The power of the majority in American society, he wrote, could erect 'formidable barriers around the liberty of opinion; within these barriers an author may write what he pleases, but woe to him if he goes beyond them.'"
alfredsnippet.name: Phys.org Post - How Peer Pressure Works in the Scientific Community
